oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bounds of concurrence and their relation with fidelity and frontier states
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ma, Zhihao
Zhang, Fu-Lin
Deng, Dong-Ling
Chen, Jing-Ling
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The bounds of concurrence in [F. Mintert and A. Buchleitner, Phys. Rev. Lett. 98 (2007) 140505] and [C. Zhang \textit{et. al.}, Phys. Rev. A 78 (2008) 042308] are proved by using two properties of the fidelity. In two-qubit systems, for a given value of concurrence, the states achieving the maximal upper bound, the minimal lower bound or the maximal difference upper-lower bound are determined analytically.
